channel.title: [PI] Ripping Custom Maps
channel.description:
Hey guys, I was searching around server downloads the other day and came across a server named vertigo or something, I saw the custom maps and i was wondering if someone would know how to rip them out to put into my source? Im using InsidiaX as the base and i would love to have the maps in there... I have tried to do this myself by replacing cache files etc, I even used toms cache editor to find the files, but i had no luck :( If someone could help me out that would be EXCELLENT!!
Thanks in advance :D
Note: im willing to add people on msn who offer help :)

item.title: [PI] Ripping Custom Maps
item.dc:creator: @Dextrell Dextrell
item.description:
@Dextrell wrote:

Leeching is such a harsh word how about we start using copied instead

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Ripping Custom Maps
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

main file cache idx4 or whatever it’s called stores maps.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Ripping Custom Maps
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

They do, although stealing another persons work is called “LEECHING”.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Ripping Custom Maps
item.dc:creator: @Dragonxile Dragonxile
item.description:
@Dragonxile wrote:

stop leeching? if i was leeching i woulda taken the server and hosted it straight away, im trying to take something from 1 server to put into another server, Im sure many other people do it -.-

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Ripping Custom Maps
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

No stop leeching, the map editor does not work on 377+. And to my knowledge there loaded through the main file cache wich cannot be copied and pasted from a 317 cache to a 614 cache.

Read full topic
